pageContext.claim: “If President Obama were there — and don't forget, he was paying no interest. We're actually paying interest. You know, he was paying no interest. He didn't have liquidity being drained out of the market in order to pay it down, which we have. How about 50 billion dollars a month? $50 billion a month.”
pageContext.analysis: Obama, of course, faced the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression, with unemployment reaching 10 percent. The economy is now basically at full employment. Zero percent interest rates would mean the economy was again in a free fall — presumably not something Trump wants.
